sentence.text: Patient 6 is the first child of nonconsanguineous parents.
He was born at 31 weeks of gestation weighing 2.336 kg (>97th centile) with a head circumference of 30.6 cm (90th centile), following a pregnancy complicated by pre-eclampsia.
He has two younger sibs who are well and both of these pregnancies were also complicated by pre-eclampsia.
He was initially noted to have a patent ductus arteriosus but this closed spontaneously.
His cranial ultrasound images showed a right choroid plexus cyst and a very small resolving left germinal matrix hemorrhage.
Motor and speech development were delayed, he crawled at 16 months, and walked at 2 years.
However, on review at age 4 years he had made considerable developmental progress and following his pre-school assessment it was decided that he did not need a statement of educational needs.
His clinical findings are illustrated in Figures 3c,d, 4c,d, and 5c.
Age 4 years his head circumference is >97th centile with his height and weight on 75th and 98th centiles, respectively.
His mother's head circumference is also >97th centile with no other features of Cantú syndrome.
